result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. OFICEE M. WILLIAMS

records.addlTxt: Notice of hearing for 9/29/2022. Moved left no address. Unable to forward. Return to sender.
Signed 9/29 with modified conditions

BATTERY(DV-REPEATER, DV), DC(DV-REPEATER, DV), SUB BAT(DV), BATTERY(DV), DC(DV)
CONDITIONS:   No contact with V1 in OPD 22-13124.  May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.
9/29/22 Child visitation/exchange through 3rd party.   The court will remove the no contact with the 3300 block of Oregon St.

3:33 PM Defendant OFICEE M. WILLIAMS in court.  Attorney Daniel Mark Muza in court for OFICEE M. WILLIAMS.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  No resolution, set another plea/sent date.  Defense requests to modify bond, no contact to no violent or remove it.  V1 did submit a letter.  The State objects to removing it or changing it to no violent, but wouldn't object to 3rd party contact.  Victim addresses the court.  The Court will amend bond to allow 3rd party contact and remove the no contact with the 3300 block. Bond Continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
from victim requesting to lift no contact.

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.

02:56 PM Defendant OFICEE M. WILLIAMS in court with attorney Nicole A Morley.  Defendant OFICEE M. WILLIAMS in custody.  Margaret Jeanne Struve appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OFICEE M. WILLIAMS appeared by video means with Attorney.  Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  Victim addresses the Court.  DE advised of DNA rights.  Record closed @ 3:07.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
